sentences.en: ‘Who can we get to babysit?’ ‘I’ll call Suzie or somebody .’
sentences.cn: “我们能请谁来看小孩呢？”“我会叫苏齐或别的什么人。”

sentences.en: "Before she came around," she says, "I was somebody in this town".
sentences.cn: “她来之前，”她说道，“我在这个镇上也算得上个人物了。”

sentences.en: "Somebody would have seen her." — "I doubt it, not on Monday."
sentences.cn: “可能有人见过她。”——“我认为不可能，不可能在星期一。”

sentences.en: A few days earlier somebody had rear-ended him.
sentences.cn: 几天之前他的车被人追尾了。

sentences.en: Has somebody helped himself to some film star's diamonds?
sentences.cn: 有人偷了某个影星的钻石了吗?

sentences.en: His cousin is somebody quite high up in the navy.
sentences.cn: 他的堂兄是一位海军高官。

sentences.en: I heard him holler out, "Somebody bombed the Church."
sentences.cn: 我听见他大叫道：“有人炸了教堂。”

sentences.en: I thought: "This cannot be happening, somebody must be playing a joke".
sentences.cn: 我想：“这不可能发生，肯定是谁在开玩笑。”

sentences.en: If I reduced somebody to tears I'd be mortified.
sentences.cn: 如果我把谁弄哭了，我会尴尬的。

sentences.en: If you're not willing to help me, I'll find somebody who will.
sentences.cn: 如果你不愿意帮我，我会去找别人。

sentences.en: She was the first teacher who’d made Paul feel like he was somebody. ＃
sentences.cn: 她是第一位让保罗觉得自己还有所作为的老师。

sentences.en: Somebody helped me mend the puncture.
sentences.cn: 有个人帮我修补扎破的轮胎。

sentences.en: Somebody must have informed on us.
Somebody’s car alarm kept me awake all night.
sentences.cn: 不知谁的汽车警报器吵得我整晚都无法入睡。

sentences.en: There’s somebody waiting to see you.
Today I heard somebody say the damnedest thing about Cross.
sentences.cn: 今天我听人说了关于克罗斯的最令人难以置信的话。

sentences.en: Why should I pay the penalty for somebody else's mistake?
Will somebody for God's sake shut that alarm off.
sentences.cn: 看在上帝的份上，谁去关掉那个闹钟吧。
你得罪了某位高层人物。

words.tran_cn: 重要的人；值得重视的事
名人,要人,大人物,伟大领袖,杰出的人,富豪

trans.tran_en: used to mean a person, when you do not know, or do not say who the person is
used to mean a person, when you do not know, or do not say who the person is
